Club Description.content:
Club members serve their community through service, education, and leadership as volunteers of the American Red Cross. 
Red Cross Clubs participate in activities that align with the Red Cross’s humanitarian mission and their five lines of service by holding regular service projects and leadership training throughout the school year to benefit members and their community.

J-club will allow students journalists from Los Altos High — from the Talon, New Media Lit, Aerie Yearbook, intro to journalism and independent publications — to meet and discuss journalism. We'll also have skill sharing sessions and hold Q&A sessions with professional journalists.

The Psychology club aims to explore a variety of mental health topics and cognitive sciences. In addition, our club will seek to learn about different career paths that can be pursued through psychology. We plan to fundraise for different mental health organizations through a variety of events, as well as promote mental health awareness on campus.

Computer Engineers of the Next Generation (CENG) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit that offers free coding classes to local elementary and middle school students, as well as summer courses to students in Guatemala. Our varied offerings include hosting Hour of Code events, Spanish curriculum, our hackathon, and coding programming courses ranging from Scratch to artificial intelligence.

Name.content: Computer Engineers of the Next Generation

Club Description.content: We will learn anatomy and physiology background information while tackling a challenging medical case related to a particular system. Actual live Harvard biomedical faculty and staff will play the roles of your patient and medical consults, nurses, and technicians, and lead you through these exciting and challenging experiences. To do so, you will interview patients, take their medical histories, request medical tests and imaging, and suggest basic physical exams using stethoscopes, EKGs, pulse oximeters, radiological scans, and other actual medical technologies.

Interact is a service club sponsored by Rotary International which gives back to the community through volunteering and fundraising. As a school club, we volunteer for both local causes organized by ourselves and international projects organized by the Bay Area Interact district.
In Criminology Club, we will learn and discuss past cases, play true crime games, and invite professionals in the criminology and medical field to give us insight about their work.

In this club, rock climbers of any and all levels, including first-time climbers, can meet with each other and share experiences with climbing. We will also be planning dates to head over to Planet Granite and climb with each other or do other activities like bouldering or slackline as a group.
The D&D club is where people can come in and play D&D, talk about TTRPGs, and have fun with friends
To foster a culture of environmental responsibility and sustainability at Los Altos High School and the local community through organizing both large scale and local events.
We are the class council for the Class of 2023. We meet to host events, fundraisers and more to boost class spirit and encourage inclusion.
We spread awareness of Judaism and Jewish culture at LAHS, providing a community for Jews and non-Jews alike.
The Video Game Modifications club focuses on collaboration to create different modifications to video games based on members' creativity.
Gymnastics team

Our purpose is to provide opportunities for people that will inspire them to choose to be kind to themselves and others, as well as offer outlets, resources, and support for mental health to bring the community together. Encourage members of our community, beyond our club, to make the conscious decision to be kind to themselves and others. We host the Mental Health Speaker Series and programs like WellPals (forming support systems).

AVID Council is a club where we strengthen the AVID community as a whole at Los Altos High School. Regardless of grade, we spend time together doing community building activities and providing support for our fellow AVID students.

In this club, you will practice competitive programming and algorithms, introduce college level computer science topics, and participate in certain programming competitions, like USACO and Codeforces.

At Hack Club, learn how to make your own full-fledged apps and websites from scratch with a variety of technology and programming languages. No prior experience is required, and we especially encourage new members to come have fun! We meet Thursdays at lunch. See you there!
Cheerleading club; for the LAHS cheer team to fundraise
Focus on all facets of aviation including education, and practical implementation of the principles of flight.
To allow students who are history fans to have a place to come together. Discuss, share ideas, learn from the past, and have fun
We will offer summer camp themed activities both active and artistic. This will be a social club which also has opportunities for skill sharing.
Our club’s purpose is to raise awareness for cancer and support cancer research, while also connecting directly with cancer patients.

We automate things for fun with end-to-end solutions including hardware, software, and electrical and are currently working on making a pinball machine play itself. No experience required, feel free to drop by!
A club that celebrates Indian heritage/culture and organizes events to promote cultural diversity on campus and within the community.
Club to promote quiz bowl and trivia, we compete in online tournaments.

STEAM LAHS is a volunteer team of students passionate about the intersection between STEAM and education. Together, we work to make STEAM an inclusive field for young students of all backgrounds and interests by creating and teaching our own curriculum to local elementary students. If you love working with kids, teaching or tutoring, exploring STEAM, or just want to try something new, come join us on Mondays at lunch in Room 633!

A virtual, collaborative club that focuses on students sharing their various STEAM-related hobbies/projects and learning from one another. STEAM industry experts will make Q&A appearances and will share their knowledge with students.

Actively Aware is a social justice advocacy group aiming to be the bridge between "What's going on around me?" and "How can I help?"
We research various international social justice issues in order to put together bi-montly pamphlets or brochures distributed around the city in efforts to not only inform our local community but to be a source of direct information on ways to help.

Los Altos High School’s Women in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (WiSTEM) club provides a safe community for women to explore their interests in STEM. We offer STEM volunteer opportunities, speaker events, team bonding activities, and networking opportunities in our community.
We organize and publish a creative zine for young people in the bay area to publish their art.
A place where students can come together, go on adventures and share their interests in kpop and anime.

We are a club that aims to create a safe space for students to learn and discuss issues pertaining to the Middle East, including the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. We’ll accomplish this through hosting a variety of lessons, guest speakers, and cultural events.

Name.content: Peace in the Middle East Club

Club Description.content: USABO club works to advance students' love of biology through engaging in competitive biology. Through curriculum and activities, club members will be able to get a deeper dive into biology while having fun, and be prepared for the USABO exam.
Enjoy modern and ancient Chinese culture together in a fun way.

Girls for Politics is student-run club that aims at empowering young adults interested in the political field. We offer numerous events that will provide members with greater political knowledge, first-hand experience, and a chance to join a welcoming, collaborative environment.
BSU’s goal is to provide a safe space for all students to thrive, discuss racial issues, learn about black culture, and form relationships with community members.

The Teen CERT club will teach and raise awareness about emergency preparedness through a pre-made online course taught and directed by the Los Altos fire Dept. Members will learn a variety of skills ranging from medical aid to fire extinguisher use.
The Aerospace Club aims to teach students about the science behind flight and the art of aviation. We will learn mainly through hands-on activities using the tools in the new Engineering Labs.
To play, learn pickle ball in a casual and competitive enviroment while connecting with friends.
To raise support for our sister school, SOPUDEP, in Haiti and solidarity with the people of Haiti in their struggle for human rights.

Our club is one that wants to play games, move around and get activities going, and also try to impact people in certain ways. For some people, though, it is more fun and better to just stick to games and sports.

Our aim is to create a community of students interested in business and finance. Hopefully by spring all club members will be involved in a venture that could potentially allow them to make money. It is a healthy environment to pursue projects that excite them and dive deeper into areas that may seem intimidating to achieve alone.

We will learn about the current situation of how ethics is being neglected in online platforms. We provide a safe space for people to learn about the “behind the scenes” action of social media and learn about the importance of ethics. By inviting different speakers from different online platform companies, members and non-members alike will be able to learn about the impacts of social media without ethics.
LAHS Volunteering Society is a club focused around volunteering and promotes it by finding opportunities for its members to sign up for.
We host friendly competitions between 2 teams every club meeting, testing your teams science skills and coordination
The Data Analysis Club is committed to making the school a better place through the power of Math, CS and critical thinking. We tutor, give lectures, and run year-long projects for LAHS students!
LA Field Hockey is a school team - both varsity and JV - which competss in the De Anza division of SCVAL.

The Russian Club serves as a casual environment for those that are interested in learning about the immensely diverse and sophisticated culture of Russia, as well as a place for those that are eager to connect with the school's community.

President of Club.content: Co-presidents: Matvey Volkov (100024292@mvla.net), Sasha Shkolnikov (100024386@mvla.net), Anton Smirnov (100023529@mvla.net)

Club Description.content: Our club is composed of two main groups: the F=ma (Physics contest) preparation group and the AP Physics 1/Physics learning groups. Our curriculum is designed to learn or review fundamental concepts in physics. More advanced students can challenge themselves by solving problems that involve calculus. All the officers hope to support each and every member’s goal in physics, and will adjust our curriculum and format accordingly if needed. We were a chartered club last year during online learning, and have experience in club leadership and all of these endeavors.

MABW club is a community-based club that provides birthday parties for children in need. We will fund raise, plan activities, decorations, food, and gifts, and then set up and put on the actual party.
This club provides resources and support for local medical clinics and organizations in need. Our main project is making hygiene/medical kits for a local homeless shelter.
Teen Tutors provides free, one-on-one tutoring to our local elementary and middle schools. Our two programs include HW Tutoring (weekday tutoring) and Reading Tutoring (on Saturdays).
Blue Crew aims to inspire Los Altos High School spirit by providing accessible ways for student to participate at events such as sports games, rallies, and dances.

The Talon is Los Altos High School's student newspaper. The paper covers local and school news, opinions, features, sports, arts & culture and more, published regularly via our website and social media, as well as print publications like tabloids and magazines throughout the year.
Math Club aims to share and promote a love for math beyond a school curriculum, and elevate students' math capabilities through practice and participation in math competitions.
Inspires more young people to learn about the brain and neuroscience.

In this club we will make crafts and cards for the homeless, people in the hospital, teachers, friends and family. It's been a hard year so I thought everyone needs some cheering up and something to let them know someone is thinking of them.
Support the cross country team

The goal of our club is for everyone to develop confidence, social skills, other important life skills, and valuable life experience through trying new things. We will plan and organize new and uncommon activities to do and goals to reach as a club. We believe that going out of our comfort zones through trying new things will help us personally develop as people and understand more about what the world has to offer. We hope that we can attract like-minded individuals to create a fun community.

Science Olympiad is an American team competition in which students compete in 23 events pertaining to various scientific disciplines, including earth science, biology, chemistry, physics, and engineering. Over 7,800 middle school and high school teams from 50 U.S. states compete each year. This club will be the team that prepares for this tournament.
The TEDxLAHS club plans and hosts the TEDx event at LAHS in March. Club members help find student and adult speakers to give TED talks, help promote the event, and help with logistics on event day.

Colors for Coats is an organization that aims to spread awareness about important issues in the public health field through creative means - from health care disparities to public policies, we create opportunities for students to collaborate and implement projects that will have a direct impact on communities. Every two months we will focus on a different public health-related topic by bringing different professionals to our platform and holding fundraisers and projects to help communities on a global scale. We emphasize leadership, creativity, and service by fostering a community of students who can take their own initiatives and bring their own ideas to help make a difference.
Celebrating and sharing the Latino Culture through out Los Altos High School.

CRCP has 5 teams in our club to make everything we do much more effective, the government, science, blog, outreach and social media teams which are each run by a club officer. By tackling different issues and working with scientists and gov officials we look up to, we make a bigger difference societal and scientific wise.

The Los Altos High School Dance Team performs at rallies, at football and basketball games, and in parades. We have weekly practices where we work on improving dance technique and learn new choreography.

Name.content: Los Altos High School Dance Team

Club Description.content: We are a service club with the goal of bringing people together to help their communities and form connections with one another in the process. We know that volunteering can be a lot more fun with friends, and can bring people from various backgrounds together, which is why we value it so dearly.
The Classical Club discusses classical music during their meetings, especially classical repertoire. You don't need to be able to play a musical instrument to join.

The Emergency Room wishes to bring more exposure and awareness to Los Altos athletes who don't have the vital experience to deal with or provide services if there were perhaps to be an emergency. Through the application of interactive and engaging activities, we hope that members will have the knowledge to apply their skills in real world circumstances.
A place where students can learn about entrepreneurship by entering in competitions
We'll meet and jam out in room 401 every Monday at lunch!
Model UN promotes civil engagement and helps students to build public speaking skills by preparing for and competing in conferences with other schools where we simulate the United Nations.

The Creative Writing Club is a place for writers to support each other and think together. Whether you prefer poetry, novel writing, songwriting, short stories, or flash fiction, this club is the place for you.
A community of surfers ranging from all levels that can come together to surf, talk about surfing, and ways to protect the ocean.

We organize tournaments that everyone can participate and win prizes. We also competes against other Bay Area high schools in the "Bay Area High School eSports League." 

Games we play: CS:GO, Valorant, Mnecraft, League of Legends.

The LAHS De-stress Club strives to reduce the skyrocketing amount of anxiety and stress that haunts a significant portion of students. We use a plethora of fun activities and projects to reduce stress and create an enjoyable community!
TGUP, formerly known as ODFL, is a service club on campus that aims to create a change in third world countries by collecting just $1 from high school students.
Jumpstart mentor meeting and planning time!
LAHS Boys Basketball Team

This is a food appreciation club, we respect and love food in different ways, including eating, cooking and reviewing different kinds of food. We plan on doing activities in which people can create connections through food :)
To host fundraisers to raise money for prom, spirit events, and class bonding in general.

President of Club.content: n/a as of now, but Riley Capuano 100024577@mvla.net

Club Description.content: Python club meets every week to learn about python and programming in general. Over the course of the year, the concepts will become more difficult and more interactive with projects and other club activities

The Science Kit aims to excite the next generation of innovators about what’s to come and what STEM holds. We are aware of the disproportionate underrepresentation of certain backgrounds in STEM, especially historically marginalized groups such as BIPOC and women. For example, women make up 47% of the total workforce but only occupy 24% of STEM jobs. Furthermore, the current COVID-19 pandemic restricts students’ access to hands-on activities that would normally take place at school. We aspire to create meaningful experiences for young thinkers with the intent of demonstrating that there is a place for everyone in STEM.
We play and learn about chess.
The girls basketball team
During club meetings, players will be able to play TCGs each other and talk about strategies. We also want to work on teaching others and helping people find new games and new friends.

We are connected to the Girltelligence organization and focus on empowering women as well as building community amongst girls at LAHS. We will work with an organization of the club's choosing as well. The organization will focus on women's issues (think organizations like the Malala Fund). In addition, the club will also remain active on the app to offer support to girls on the app and brainstorm ideas to improve the app.
In culinary club we strive to provide an environment in which brand-new and seasoned chefs alike can have fun in the kitchen and learn about the chemistry that is involved in everyday cooking.
We are a club that helps to unify Christians on the LAHS campus, and be a resource for those who are interested in Christianity.

In Mock Trial, we read and learn about a case, build a prosecution and defense team with attorneys and witnesses, and compete in a simulated courtroom environment coached by real lawyers and presided over by county judges.
We learn, play, and teach ukulele. We play songs together by singing while playing the chords on ukulele.
The MVLA Speech and Debate Team fosters critical thinking and helps students improve public speaking skills through participation in speech and debate events on the local and national circuit.

Club Advisor.content: Mr. Moul, Mrs. Hannon, Mrs. Abel

Club Description.content: The Class Council of 2022 is in place to listen to the voices and wishes of the class of 2022 and organize events and fundraisers accordingly. We will be planning big events like senior prom, as well as smaller fundraisers along the way. Anyone who is in the class of 2022 is welcome to join us at our meetings.

InspireAI aims to teach LAHS students about the principles of Machine and Deep Learning, subsets of artificial intelligence. As a club, we host guest speakers from large tech companies, complete complex AI projects together, and learn more about the advancing field of AI.
A safe space on campus as well as a student run resource for LGBTQ+ information and issues.
InPrint aims to share new books online and cultivate a community of readers that are learning about the literary industry and books itself as it evolves.
Tilt - Shift is aimed at exposing students to diverse cinema and giving them a place to explore how film both reflects and impacts our world.
We lead monthly meeting where we talk about social issues concerning girls, advocating for underrepresented girls, and fundraising for girls through projects in our community.

Robotics is a hands on, student led club for aspiring stem, business, and design students. Between January and March, we build a robot for the FIRST robotics competition and compete in local and regional competitions.

President of Club.content: Co-Presidents: Andrew Kim, 100023407@mvla.net; Jeremiah Wong, 100024451@mvla.net; Anthony Wang, 100023576@mvla.net; Justin Chou, 100023300@mvla.net; Nasir Naqvi 100023474@mvla.net

Club Description.content: The function of End Parkinson's LAHS is to help spread awareness about Parkinson's disease and work with the Parkinson's Foundation to help find a cure through fundraising.
